text: Anatoliy Solovianenko (September 25, 1932 â€“ July 29, 1999) was a Soviet and Ukrainian tenor. He was a People's Artist of the USSR (1978). He was born in Donetsk (Stalino at that time) into a mining family. He graduated from Donetsk Polytechnic Institute in 1954. He also studied singing with Alexander Korobeichenko from 1950. He recorded 18 LPs of arias, romances and songs.Translated narod.ru webpage: Biography and discography of Solovyanenko (in Russian) Anatoliy Solovyanenko died from a heart attack on 29 July 1999. == Awards == * 1967 - Honoured Artist of Ukraine * 1975 - People's Artist of the USSR * 1980 - Lenin Prize * 1982 - Miner's Glory Medal, Order of Friendship of Peoples * 1993 - Badge of Honour from President of Ukraine * 1997 - Taras Shevchenko National Prize == References == Category:1932 births Category:1999 deaths Category:Tenors Category:European opera singers
title: Anatoliy Solovianenko
